ygData.subject: Re: Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: Not bad, Xela -- 558 words to my 438! But, I think you still have to compete with my July 19th two-part post, and Shooman is also a contender for the long-post
ygData.messageBody:
Not bad, Xela -- 558 words to my 438! But, I
think you still have to compete with my July 19th
two-part post, and Shooman is also a contender for the
long-post crown . . . <br><br>But, on the topic at hand.
There's a lot to be said for the argument that
_knowledge_ is twinking. I can no longer start a Dwarf or
Wood Elf without knowing exactly where to go, who to
talk to and get quests from. I long for the true
newbie days, when you really had no idea what was going
on, what was around the next corner. That, more than
boredom, would be what drives players to a new game such
as DAoC, I think. I probably won't move, however, as
I like EQ a lot.<br><br>So, what's a little FS or
bronze between friends? On top of that is the twinking
handouts given you by other players. My characters traded
between them, giving the warrioress a Fine Steel 2H Sword
. . . this was after some guy walked out of the
bank, said, "Can you use this?" and gave me a Velium
Short Sword. Yow.<br><br>So, my attitude toward at
least mild twinking has evidently changed. But if any
of you ever catch me with a second level warrior in
full bronze (which I've seen), feel free to /rude me
and hound me for hypocrisy.<br><br>Kharlisht, who has
way too much time on his hands at work
